docs.lead_paragraph: Whether Barack Obama wins or loses in November, the Democratic Party’s attention will immediately turn to 2016.
docs.abstract: David Leonhardt news analysis asserts that jockeying for the Democratic nomination for president in 2016 has already begun because no matter what happens on Election Day, Pres Obama will no longer be the future of the Democratic Party.
docs.snippet: Whether Barack Obama wins or loses in November, the Democratic Party’s attention will immediately turn to 2016.

headline.main: Health Care Payers Push Back Against Costs

docs.abstract: The opacity surrounding prices and the practice of charging different buyers different prices for identical goods or services contribute mightily to the cost of health care, but at the least the former may be on the way out, an economist writes.
docs.snippet: The opacity surrounding prices and the practice of charging different buyers different prices for identical goods or services contribute mightily to the cost of health care, but at the least the former may be on the way out, an economist writes.

docs.lead_paragraph: Mayor Angel Taveras said that without reduced city pensions and a switch to Medicare for retirees, Providence would run out of money in June.

headline.seo: Providence, R.I., Mayor Proposes Cuts to Avert Bankruptcy
headline.main: Mayor of Providence Seeks Urgent Steps in City’s Financial Crisis
headline.print_headline: Mayor of Providence Seeks Urgent Steps in City’s Financial Crisis

docs.abstract: Mayor Angel Taveras of Providence, RI, says that without reduced city pensions and a switch to Medicare for retirees, Providence will run out of money in June; calls for bigger contributions from major tax-exempt universities and hospitals in city for additional help.
docs.snippet: Mayor Angel Taveras said that without reduced city pensions and a switch to Medicare for retirees, Providence would run out of money in June.

byline.original: By JESS BIDGOOD and ABBY GOODNOUGH

docs.lead_paragraph: New regulations are intended to make it easier for retirees to transfer money from their 401(k)s into an annuity that would guarantee payments until they die.

headline.seo: New Treasury Rules Ease Purchase of Annuity With 401(k)
headline.main: New Treasury Rules Ease 401(k) Annuity Purchase
headline.print_headline: New Treasury Rules Ease 401(k) Annuity Purchase

docs.abstract: Treasury Department issues new regulations intended to make it easier, and maybe less costly, for middle-class retirees to transfer money from their 401(k) account into an annuity that would guarantee payments until they die.
docs.snippet: New regulations are intended to make it easier for retirees to transfer money from their 401(k)s into an annuity that would guarantee payments until they die.

docs.lead_paragraph: Mitt Romney has said that his comments about not caring about the very poor were taken out of context. But the more context you give them, the worse it gets.
docs.abstract: Paul Krugman Op-Ed column asserts that Mitt Romney's stating that he is not concerned about the very poor, which he claims was taken out of context, does in fact accurately describe how Romney feels about the poor; argues that, in context, the comment is far more revealing about how little he is concerned both with the poor and government programs that are designed to help them; asserts that Romney has done away with the pretense that conservative politicians care about anybody but the wealthy.
docs.snippet: Mitt Romney has said that his comments about not caring about the very poor were taken out of context. But the more context you give them, the worse it gets.

docs.lead_paragraph: Federal health officials recommended on Thursday that all boys be routinely vaccinated against infection with human papillomavirus, or HPV.

headline.main: Officials Recommend the HPV Vaccine for All Boys
headline.print_headline: Officials Recommend the HPV Vaccine For All Boys

docs.abstract: Federal health officials recommend that all boys be routinely vaccinated against human papillomavirus, or HPV; since 2006, the vaccine has been recommended for girls and young women, largely because HPV infection can cause cervical cancer, but the vaccine also protects against genital warts in men and women, and lowers the risk of developing head, neck and anal cancers.
docs.snippet: Federal health officials recommended on Thursday that all boys be routinely vaccinated against infection with human papillomavirus, or HPV.
